intro: Psychotria horizontalis var. psilophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Psychotria, is a species native to parts of Central and South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, known for its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as tropical forests. Its leaves are elliptical and have a distinctive dark green color with a slightly hairy texture. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often visited by various pollinators.
